item.title: Exercises
item.description: Exercises Hi! This is just a collection of write-ups of exercises that I found around and, for one reason or another, found quite cool. Spoiler warning, I guess? Algebra: Chapter 0 Group Theory 3.1+3.2 Let us be in a category with products. Let $\varphi: G \to H$ be a morphism. We show that there is a unique morphism denoted as $\varphi \times \varphi: G \times G \to H \times H$ compatible with the natural projections.
